etymology.description: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + phonetic: 阿(阿) (ā) = sound or exclamation made by mouth -> exclamation or particle
etymology.interpretation: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") suggests sound production, while 阿(阿) (ā) provides the phonetic cue. Together, they form a character used for exclamations or as a particle in sentences.

examples.chinese: 天气真好啊(天氣真好啊)。
快走啊(快走啊)，别迟到了啊(別遲到了啊)。
examples.pinyin: Kuài zǒu a, bié chídào le a.
examples.english: Hurry up, and don't be late!
